group condition.definition: users can set how to group the records in a table

view.definition: A table can be displayed in different views - kanban,grid,gantt and gallary

Kanban view.definition: In kanban view,cards represents work items and columns represents each stage of the process.

grid view.definition: In grid view,records are listed like spreadsheets.

gallery view.definition: In gallery view,records are displayed like cards.

Gantt view.definition: In gantt view,records are organized by its timelines.

filter.definition: The filter function will take dataset and return only the rows of data that meet the criteria you specify.

group.definition: The records are categorized based on group types

sort.definition: To sort records in an ascending or descending order

row height.definition: adjust the row height of the record

text.definition: You can write in text under this field type

single option.definition: You can only select one option from the list under the field type

multiple options.definition: You can select multiple options from the list under the field type

one-way link.definition: Link data with other tables without linking back

two-way link.definition: Link data with other tables and link back

formula.definition: A field used to do calculations in a table

flow.definition: A field in base. A flow contains a series of steps that need to be completed in a process.

smart import.definition: Bitable will automatically sort the data you import

change icon.definition: change the icon of bitable on homepage

configure view.definition: Set view permission,can choose between public,Locked or private view

public view.definition: Once you change a table to public view,all collaborators can edit view settings.

locked view.definition: Once the view is locked,no one can edit its view configuration like filter,gruop or sort.

private view.definition: Once you change a table to private view,other collaborators can no longer access this view.

index field.definition: The first field of the table

protection settings.definition: The place to set up protection view for the table.

can manage.definition: Users with that permission type can edit the view settings and permission settings.

protected fields.definition: Fields that are protected,only visible to certain collaborators based on the protection settings

Base advanced permissions.definition: Advanced permissions feature allows the user to set specific permissions for individual records or fields.

form.definition: A type of view in Bitable. It can be sent to other users via Docs asistant for collecting information.

respondent.definition: User who is invited to fill in the form.

automation.definition: A feature that allows user to set up combinations of Triggers and Actions to help automate repetitive actions. Under automation feature, each new process is called a "automation".

run.definition: A workflow will run automatically when the trigger conditions are met.

activate.definition: There's an "Activate workflow" toggle button. Once activated,the workflow becomes active and will be run when the trigger conditions are met.

active.definition: Describes the state of certain workflows. A worflow can be active but not triggered.

not activated.definition: Describes the state of certain workflows. If a workflow is not activated,it won't be run even when the trigger conditions are met.

step.definition: Everytime something changed in the table will be counted as a step. For example,step 1 or 2 etc. For each step,you can set a trigger and its subsequent action.

action.definition: When the trigger and the other conditions are met,the specified action(s) will be performed.

trigger.definition: A trigger is a pre-requisite for certain actions to take place. After you set a trigger,you could add 1 or more conditions that have to be met in order for the action to happen.

trigger time.definition: When the trigger time arrives,the subsequent action happens.

select a day or range.definition: Including yesterday,today,tomorrow,and the day after tomorrow.

dashboard.definition: The user can add a dashboard in bitable for more straightforward data analysis. On a dashboard,the user can add different types of charts using the data in the bitable.

Dashboard.definition: Feature name. With the Dashboard feature,the user can create many dashboards.

Base Assistant.definition: A bot for Base,performing the actions like adding or modifying records and sending messages to users in the automated worflow.

phone number.definition: A field type,in which you can enter a phone number and can be used to import contacts on mobile.

location.definition: A field type,with which you can either enter a location or choose from the map.

Lookup.definition: A field type developed based on the LOOKUP function. You can use lookup field to quickly find and reference data from the same or other tables that meet specified conditions.

role.definition: A permission group used in Bitable advanced permissions feature. You can assign collaborators with rows/columns permissions and add them as the role members.

HTTP request.definition: An action in Bitable's automated workflow. With the automated workflow settings,network requests can be sent manually or automatically to specified URLs,which allows calls to third-party platforms.

translations.ja: HTTP リクエストを送信

extension.definition: Custom functionality developed by third-party developers in Base

Workflow.definition: A workflow is a sequence of tasks that are part of a larger process or goal. Compared to automations, workflows support medium to high complexity processes such as if/else conditions.

Layout.definition: This is a block in the dashboard that can add  and combine different types of blocks such as charts, views and extensions.

Bezo.definition: Bezo is the overseas version of Base, a platform where anyone can create the tools they need to run every aspect of their work.

Workspace.definition: Workspaces are spaces in the organization where teams can have a whole bunch of boards, folders, dashboards, docs, and forms

Loop.definition: Loop is a feature in the workflow that repeatedly executes a set of logic until a specified condition is reached.

Base Lab.definition: Base lab is an entry that presents advanced features on the homepage to users, such as : Field shortcuts, AI-generated texts and dashboards.

Query Page.definition: Through query page, users can simply set or input query conditions without entering the base to find specified data.

Auto-send dashboard.definition: Dashboard that is sent automatically based on the trigger conditions via automations.

translations.ja: ダッシュボードの自動送信

Smart color.definition: This is a feature empowered by AI. Users can click on "Smart color" button to generate a matching color palette.

Conditional coloring.definition: This is a feature name that users can apply coloring to the cells, fields or records by adding filter conditions.

translations.ja: 条件付きカラーリング

Time Machine.definition: Time Machine is the new feature name of "Edit history" on sv6 version. In Time machine, you can view historical records in it and restore to a certain version.

Add Fields To Group.definition: Add multiple types of fields into a group, and manage these fields by the group

translations.ja: フィールドのグルーピング

Kanban view.definition: In kanban view, cards represents work items and columns represents each stage of the process.

grid view.definition: In grid view, records are listed like spreadsheets.

automation.definition: A feature that allows user to set up combinations of Triggers and Actions to help automate repetitive actions. Under automation feature, each new process is called a "automation".
